intro: Cosmelia, commonly known as the "flower of the sea," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Cosmelia species are typically shrubs or small trees, often with milky sap and lance-shaped leaves. These plants are well adapted to saline and arid conditions, making them resilient in coastal environments.
